content: I have the playpass and I feel ripped off for downloading this, $15 for a freaking mobile game? Y'all are just greedy terrible people

Gameplay got a solid core mechanic, not sure if I like that the game is over after defeating one boss. Matching panel is kind of dark towards the back making some symbols seem the same from the shape. All in all a solid game that could do with some more progression!
Loved this on pc, was waiting eagerly for it on mobile. Sadly bugs made me remove a star... ‚òπÔ∏è

Been playing the game non stop since purchasing! Loads of fun and a great time killer. The games difficulty scales to be harder as you progress through floors making it a constant battle to manage the board, mana, and turn orders which is really engaging. The combat is smart and challenging. There are some glaring bugs that will halt an entire run in its tracks and make you have to restart like the gameboard freezing while transitioning to or from combat. I would like to see the trinket details2
Excellent game!
if you can just get the play pass and then unsub and you get the game for free üëåüëå
Bumbo good game! Me recommend Bumbo fow everywan!!! Me wish could give ten stars.
Fantastic port of a great PC game. Aside from some touch sensitivity issues it's a great way to play a great game.
Port is pretty great! Google Games sign in does not work, so save data is not shared between devices. Definitely 5* if that is fixed.

Please fix the bugs in the game. Game freezes at random stages. Was almost at the end of a level when it froze. I have the PC version of this and it works great. If this game was free I'd give it 5 stars but I spent $20 on it. A game can take 40 minutes to complete so it's frustrating when you're 30 minutes in and the game freezes and you can't restart it as you will lose your progress.

I loved The Binding of Isaac on PC and this game has the same dark-religious theme that I loved from that game. The problems lie with the pricing, albeit I got it from the play pass and for that it feels like a steal, but for people that don't ¬£15 is far too much. In comparison to BOI, there is much less content. There is a fraction of the items and bosses and therefore replayability. Overall, it's a brilliant game but has flaws, especially when compared to the masterpiece that is BOI.

Add a save feature. Kind of silly that it isn't in the mobile port, seeing as how people play mobile games to fill gaps in time and close their phones mid game. Makes it quite difficult to actually finish a run. Save. Save. Save please.
Can't save and if you load any other app it crashes.
Ok

The game is good but it has a huge downside. It is stupidly long and at the end of the day you will feel frustrated because you have 1 hour levels and you can't save. If you die, you need to start all over again. The game is not particularly easy, you will die manny times for sure. After you play this, you'll find yourself angry... not entertained or challenged.
Awesome
Good gameplay BUT - Needs a save/continue - google play sign in is buggy

The game is okay, but the controls are fickle. There seems to be no save when exiting the app. The game play seems interesting but is not very readable. I got it from play pass, and I think it's fine there, but 15‚Ç¨ listed price is asking a bit much in comparison.
Godly

I have hundreds of hours in isaac and love the dev so I was looking forward to this game. However it is way too dark (as opposed to bright) and the controls are really bad. The price is also steep for what it is - if I had bought it and not used it on game pass I would have been upset.
Amazingly fun

Everything in this game works just fine, including the controls that keep getting complained about. Overall, this game just isn't for me but I don't like BoI either (art style and theme are my main reasons). For those having trouble with the controls; you don't have to touch the piece that you want to move. Grab any piece on the row or collum and you can move the whole thing. I have big hands (size 14 ring) and have no problems placing or seeing my pieces.
Great game but needs a move confirmation as mentioned its very frustrating when it doesn't move where you want it.
just a black screen
Diffrent take on a classic 'match three' (or in this case match four). Controls may be a problem for someone but in my case there wasn't any difficult moments. Just give it a try.

Excellent game, it truly is. But Ed, please PLEASE add a save feature! I own a business, and I constantly have to put my phone down. I quite often forget and close my apps, and then my entire run is GONE! If I could save and come back to it, this would be a 5 star game all day long. But since it's barely playable for me without a save feature, I sadly have to give it a lower review rating. Please Ed, please add a save feature!
The binding of Candy Crush

Great game! I would have given 5 stars IF there was some sort of save function added to the game. It is frustrating when you have to leave the game to write a text and then come back 5 seconds later to find that you have to start over.

Love the game. Enjoy the PC version and this is a good port. Wish there was a save system as if you close the app sometimes it will restart and progress is lost. Also allow us to cancel spells and trinkets if we dont want them after selecting one. There are a few bugs as well.
No saving mid run? Seriously?

For some reason the game doesn't save and every time I open it I have to start over. Not sure if this is intended or not but it effectively means that you have to commit to at least 30 minutes at a time to play it.
Probably the best match game on the whole store with some roguelike flair.

The biggest issue, for me, is controls. The game itself is fine, but in a smaller screen it's nearly impossible to tell exactly where you're moving a tile, because your finger is on it. There are work arounds, but the fact that you need to work around the issue at all really takes away from the game.

Abysmal touch controls. For a generic match 4 game there is no excuse for you to drag the pieces where you need them then they jump 2 to 3 spaces in a random direction. Not recommended in a free game let alone one for 15 bucks. You'd get better bang for you buck if you just got 15 bucks in quarters and flipped them into an open sewer. Probably less random too. Could be a good game if they could fix the controls.

Fantastic game, not tremendously difficult, love the art style. The gameplay is akin to a match three but with an element of strategy. It's absolutely worth the asking price, there's an awful lot of work gone into this game, and it's worth also noting that there are ZERO free to play mechanics employed here, where most other developers would have shoveled it in.

Same twisted feel that I loved about Binding of Isaac, but a whole different style of game play. The combat system definitely takes a bit to get used to and wouldn't be bad except that its a huge pain in the ass trying to rotate the pieces on screen. Little icons+fat fingers creates huge blind spots and as soon as you remove your finger it locks in the move. Dont know how to fix the issue aside from maybe manually locking in a move but it definitely hurts the experience

Graphics are poor for a mobile game. The controls are too sensitive. Nice challenge when you finally realized you had to MATCH 5 for anything to be effective. Poorly explained tutorial, and the texts /numbers are really small on my device. You don't seem to get fresh health after each level and if you run out of hearts you go back to the beginning. Lose your coins and everything.

Controller support for this would be greatly appreciated. Its hard to see where I am placing a tile because my finger is on it. I've found myself wasting a turn placing something one spot shy of the spot I'm going for. Its already deceptively hard, unless I'm just terrible at it. I don't really see myself playing it anymore unless controller support is added, though. I'd at least stand a little better chance being able to see what I'm doing. It seems fun, just too difficult using my fingers.
I would give this 5 stars but it won't let me sign into google play games. It acts like it's going to load and then doesn't. Please fix.d
Very nice and helpful
Got all achievements on pc version, still love it on mobile
Gets boring quickly, music is horrible

It is fun but gameplay is slow. Your finger takes up 1/4 of the tile board when moving encouraging misplaced pieces. There is no way to bring up your spells during a treasure room or at the shop, making it impossible to strategize unless you remember in your head. I used Google Play Pass, but the game is not worth the full asking price.
Very expensive matching 3 game with fart jokes
Not at all worth $14.99. I wouldn't even play it for free. It's a matching game with just about no originality whatsoever, go download one of the free ones.

Awesome game, some fixes needed. Haven't played it on PC, but have been looking forward to playing this since release. Biggest issue is the fact that there is no automated save feature for your progress through a run. If you close the app mid-run, or maybe it crashes on you, you lose all progress and you have to start over, so thats kind of annoying. If this can get fixed it'll be a big improvement. The only other bug I've ran into so far the music crashes at times when u minimize the app
This is not a deck building roguelike, this is a match three with poop and butt jokes...
it's a good game, but i REALLY abhor the fact i can't back out of replacing spells i want to keep by accident. i had to start over too many times over this stupid flaw.
Just for the trailer.
It's good. 5/7 perfect score
Its an OK puzzle game, but its been done before and at a less egregious price. I don't care if you made the Binding of Isaac. This isn't Isaac, and it's definitely not worth 15 USD.
Rubbish
Made me so horny man loved it
Stupidly difficult = zero enjoyment
Love the PC version, but the controls are more functional on a tablet by far. Hope to see more content for this game!
A very engaging and entertaining deck-building roguelike. Lots of fun replay value. It's like a Binding of Isaac style Bejewelled. Bum-no likes! Is worth your coin.
This is a very solid port. I always thought this game would be well suited for mobile. I have put many hours into this game on the PC, but this is now my preferred way to play. Kudos!

Okay , I'm pleasantly surprised . I absolutely LOVE the binding of issac I have dumped 999 hours into in. Bum-bo is way different than issac but similar enough to keep that same feel and vibes but different enough to be a new game that stands alone. I look forward to the hours of play I will have. Thanks MARCUS !

It's a really fun puzzle game with a fair amount of content. The price is maybe high for a mobile game but I think it's only fair considering it's exactly the same as the PC version. It's getting a future update with some fixes and a bit more content so you could wait for that to release if you're not convinced yet. If you like the tile matching gameplay (with turn-based combat and fun combo enablers etc.) than you will really dig it! Get dem coins!

Tldr: a great, fun game with some flaws. I played bumbo when it was released on pc about a year ago, and I really enjoyed it. I remember thinking that it would make a great mobile port, and here we are. I would recommend it to anyone who likes match three games and/or BoI. There are definitely some bugs, like sometimes when spinning the wheel in the shop I will get the money payout over and over. The $15 price is a little high for a mobile game too, so I would say buy on pc first.
Not great, the touchscreen with this game is impossible. I don't know about the pc version. But this game frustrated me to another level in about 5 minutes.
Although it's a different genre from tboi it's still an amazing game in it's own rights

Thought this was going to be a binding of isaac card game (would have been cool) but instead I got binding of isaac candycrush. It's as boring as it is frustrating if you're not good at candycrush type games it's very annoying because that's how you attack so you just keep skipping your turn essentially because you cant make a match. I don't mind difficult games as long as they're fun but The Legend of Bum-bo is not, maybe it gets better I don't know but I was bored and frustrated within 10 mins
Not worth the money they are asking
Love it!!!, Bought it on PC, buying it here
